Comments_List: A lot of reactions were thrown at us, which was annoying but I think seeing reactions over and over again helped me pick out the important underlying reaction dynamics in organic chemistry.
I gained some of the necessary skills for organic chemistry careers--including a strong knowledge of some of the most widely used reactions in laboratory syntheses.
Increased insight into various organic mechanisms
Too fast. Unclear what reactions we actually need to know.

Strength: Great overview of many reactions in organic chemistry.
Weakness: Not enough time during the summer to really dig in.
Its very stressful to squish this much material into the summer session but Professor Parr was understanding and taught it well.

I wish the professor was more clear and organized during his explanations. We left everyday 10-15 minutes later, and it just seemed as if we did a bunch of stuff and I had no idea what had happened when I left the classroom.

I really liked the real life applications.
Do it during the year, you need more time to really digest all the information
Yes. It's a great class, well taught and with interesting material.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. It is actually a really fun course to take with Professor Parr. Also, you finally gain the necessary knowledge to think critically about chemical synthesis pathways.
No. Too much information crammed in little time, making it hard to prepare for exams.
It is Organic Chemistry, which means you are about to take it if you need it. Good luck !
